name: StyleFeeder
overview:
StyleFeeder is a social bookmarking service targeted specifically at shopping. StyleFeeder allows users to browse the web and add clothing, gadgets, or other items they find to their StyleFeed, which they can then share with friends. The service also analyzes the items a person adds, enabling it to create personalized recommendations and an improved shopping search engine.

Additionally, StyleFeeder has created widgets that display a user’s StyleFeed, and can be added to profiles at social networks such as Facebook or Myspace, or blogs or personal websites. StyleFeeder has some social networking capabilities built into its own site, as well. For example, it identifies users with similar tastes, called StyleTwins, and makes it easy for these users to get to know each other.

The social shopping space is becoming fairly crowded, and StyleFeeder’s competitors include StylePath, another Boston-based start-up, as well as eBay’s new Neighborhoods product.

funding_rounds.source_description: Shopping Engine StyleFeeder Completes $2 Million First Round

acquisition.source_description: Time Inc. To Buy Personal Shopping Engine StyleFeeder

milestones.description: StyleFeeder Receives LinkShare Technology Genius Award.
milestones.source_text:
NEW YORK, June 30 /PRNewswire/ -- LinkShare, a leading pay-per-action marketing network, announced the winners of the 2008 LinkShare Golden Link Awards at the company's annual awards event hosted at The Plaza in New York City on Monday, June 23. This gala awards ceremony drew more than 300 leading executives together to recognize achievements and innovation in performance-based marketing.

The prelude to LinkShare's annual Symposium, a daylong industry event covering innovative and collaborative trends on the Web, the awards celebrate the best of breed in both publishers and advertisers doing business online today.

"LinkShare celebrate the best in performance-based marketing with our annual Golden Link Awards," said Yasuhisa ("Yaz") Iida, Co-President of LinkShare. "We congratulate all of the 2008 LinkShare Golden Link Award winners, as well as this year's nominees."

The Golden Link Awards received its best response ever, with more LinkShare advertisers and publishers nominated than ever before, according to Jonathan Levine, Co-President of LinkShare. "This is proof that these awards have come to mean something in our community and that's exactly what we had hoped would happen when we started this five years ago," said Levine.

    The 2008 Golden Link Awards Winners Are:

    -- Walmart.com:  Innovative Advertiser of the Year
    -- Buzzillions.com:  Innovative Publisher of the Year
    -- Petite Sophisticate:  Best New Advertiser
    -- Clever Parties Inc.:  Best New Publisher:
    -- FabulousSavings.com:  Advertiser's Choice Award
    -- Ice.com:  Publisher's Choice Award
    -- NET-A-PORTER UK:  International Advertiser of the Year
    -- McAfee, Vertive Inc. (tie):  Best Performance-Based Search Strategy
    -- Chase:  Best Integrated Lead Generation Campaign
    -- 1ShopMall:  MVP - Most Valuable Publisher for Lead Generation
    -- Dell Canada/Airmilesshops.ca:  Best Integrated Multi-Channel Marketing
    -- Eastbay:  Best Overall Online Distribution Strategy
    -- StyleFeeder:  Technology Genius Award
    -- Revenue Magazine:  Performance Marketing's Most Vocal Advocate


The 2008 Golden Link Awards winners were selected by an esteemed panel of industry experts. Visit www.linkshare.com for a full list of award finalists and winners.

About LinkShare

LinkShare Corporation provides ecommerce businesses with a wide range of online marketing services including Search Marketing (SEM), Lead Generation and Affiliate Marketing. Advertisers can increase their online sales by leveraging LinkShare's massive performance marketing network along with expert consultative services and patented technology. Superior service combined with technology innovation allows advertisers and publishers to acquire and retain new customers, increase revenue and drive results.

LinkShare clients include Fortune 500 and other prominent and emerging companies doing business online, including J.C. Penney, 1-800-Flowers.com, American Express, and Avon Products. LinkShare was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in New York City, with offices in San Francisco, Chicago, London and Tokyo. LinkShare is a division of Rakuten, Inc.
milestones.source_description: LinkShare Corporation Announces 2008 Golden Link Award Winners
